casebody.data:
Ebenezer Hill vs. William I. Edwards. Mildred Ogden Hill vs. William I. Edwards. Third Judicial District, Bridgeport,

April Term, 1927

Wheeler, C. J., Curtis, Maltbie, Hinman and Wolfe, Js.

Argued April 22d —decided June 6th, 1927. John Keogh, for the appellant (defendant). Joseph R. Swan of New York City and James E. Brinckerhoff, for the appellees (plaintiffs). Per Curiam.

The questions arising on the corrections of the finding must be determined in favor of the plaintiff in each case. This conclusion disposes of the appeals.

There is no error.
